description: Students focus on the natural history of Upper Midwest vertebrates and phylogenetic,
morphological, and functional relationships of these animals. Laboratories include identification,
morphology, and specimen preparation. During field trips, students document bird migrations,
amphibian chorusing, and other animal activities. Independent projects explore topics ranging
from bluebird nesting behavior to thermal conductivity and insulation in animals. Students attend
lectures plus one 3-hour laboratory per week. Prerequisites: Biology 125, 126, or Chemistry/Biology
